page.title: 13CHANGING LAND USE,KILTARLITY
page.content: In recent years,the pattern of land use has changed in the area.Most of the small{crofts}have been de-crofted and this has allowed many more new houses to be built on old crofting land.Most of the owners of the land stll grow some crops and keep a few animals in addition to their main jobs. One example of development away from crofting is Highland Liliums,a garden centre set on two former crofts,which specialises in growing lily bulbs for export worldwide.There are 24 "tunnel houses" for growing a variety of plants,and this year the owners,Callum and Nancy MacRitchie,will produce 10,000 lily bulbs,20,000 bedding plants,100,000 herbaceous plants, 100,000 alpine plants and 20,000 heather plants on the old croft site.
